Play:
The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo
(Shinjū Yoigōshin / 心中宵庚申)

Written By: Chikamatsu Monzaemon (近松門左衛門)

First Staged: 1722

Reference: Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku May 1975, February 1982 Performance Program; Chikamatsu: 5 Late Plays, translated and annotated by C. Andrew Gerstle (New York: Columbia University Press, c2001)

– Click image to view.

Performances:

November 1976: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

May 1979: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

November 1981: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

February 1982: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

February 1985: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

November 1987: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

February 1990: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

August 1993: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

February 1994: The Love Suicide of Hambei and Ochiyo

Characters:

Okaru (Ane Okaru / 姉おかる)

Onabe, a maid (Gejo Onabe / 下女お鍋)

Otake, a maid (Gejo Otake / 下女お竹)

Okiku, a maid (Gejo Okiku / 下女お菊)

Ochiyo (Nyōbō Ochiyo / 女房お千代)

Kinzo (Hyakushō Kinzō / 百姓金蔵)

Heiemon (Shimada Heiemon / 島田平右衛門)

Hambei (Yaoya Hanbei / 八百屋半兵衛)

Iemon's wife (Iemon nyobo / 伊右衛門女房 (半兵衛母, 八百屋の母))

Tahei (Oi Tahei / 甥太兵衛)

Priest Sainen (Sainenbō / 西念坊)

Iemon (Yaoya Iemon / 八百屋伊右衛門)

San, a maid (Gejo San / 下女さん)

Matsu, an apprentice (Decchi Matsu / 丁稚松)

Buddhist devotee (Gōshin mairi / 庚申参り)

Palanquin bearer (Kagoya / 駕屋)
